line.en: 'Asa, do you know why people admire birds so\nmuch?'
That was so long ago. It happened when the\nwindmills that now line this hill were just being\nbuilt.
I didn't know why Grandfather had invited me that\nday, but it seemed that he was trying to cheer me\nup, since I'd been feeling down.
Unlike me, he didn't try to flatter or suck up to\npeople. He was simply an open minded person who\nknew how to care for other people's feelings.
'It's because people can't fly. People are beings\nwithout wings, and people admire what they can't\nreach; they long for it.'
Even though I was very young at the time, I still\nremember how strongly I sympathized with those\nwords.
Admiration. Longing.
Those strong emotions were always with me.
'And I think you feel that even more than most\npeople, Asa.'
'I think that's your strong point. I'm sure\nyou'll become the type of person others look up\nto.'
The sky. Those distant heights.
The place that I yearn for, but can't reach. It's\nalways nearby...
Making me feel like perhaps I can reach it.
Perhaps that's why I longed for it so much.
But... My arms could never reach.
Despite difficulties such as losing our garage\nand the absence of our advisor, we managed to\nstart up our Soaring Club activities again.

To be honest, rather than Soaring Club just
starting back up on its own, it was more a matter
of Akari using the rights of the student
government as an emergency measure.
'Aoi, you look happy.'

'Yeah, things seem to be going well. For a while
there I was really worried, but it looks like we
can start aiming for the sky again, and that
makes me happy.'
'I'm really excited too, to think that we can aim\nfor the sky.'
Our members were growing.
'By the way, where's Yoru?'
'Today's her turn to help clean the classroom, so\nshe said she'd be late.'
'I see. So she should be coming later.'
'Probably.'
Yoru still wasn't an actual club member.
So it wouldn't be strange if she didn't show up\nat all.
'But it seems like Yoru's starting to get used to\nSoaring.'
'Really? I always thought she didn't like us.'
'She is. She says she only comes because I'm\nhere, but it really is rare for her to interact\nso much with other people.'
'She's got a pretty stern way of talking to us.'
'She's always like that, whenever she's talking\nto anyone other than family.'
'I'd thought that she didn't want to have\nanything to do with us common people.
It felt like she was discriminating against us,\nor at least looking down on us.
'Yoru really is a good girl deep down, but since\nshe rejects people around her like that, I get\njust a little worried about her.'
'Really? You really seem like a big sister when\nyou say that.'
'You mean I don't usually seem like a big\nsister?'
'Sorry, sorry. You're twins, after all, so age\ndifference doesn't really matter.'
'That doesn't make me feel any better.'
Asa put on an upset face, pretending to cry.
She was fun to talk to, reacting honestly to what\nI said.
Recently, I'd been going to the club together\nwith Asa and Yoru a lot.
I thought it would make it easier for Asa to come\nalong, since she was still holding back a bit in\nfront of me and the other older students.
At the dorm, Kanako was close to the twins and\nhelped look after them, but she wasn't in the\nclub.
So I was filling in for her.
'You're always teasing me, Aoi! I don't like you\nanymore!'
'In that case I don't like you either.'
'Don't hate me for that...'
'You're so funny, Asa!'
But even more than that, I just enjoyed talking\nto them.
And I may have been getting a little carried away\nwith the idea that I now had junior members in my\nclub.
'Um, Aoi, I just noticed, but...'
'What is it?'
'It's just the two of us here now.'
'Ah... S, sorry. Is that a problem?'
It's normal for me to hang out with Ageha and\nKotori, but if someone saw me walking alone with\nAsa and started some weird rumors...
'N, not at all! I was just worried that it might\nbe a problem for you!'
'No, I don't mind at all. I was just worried that\nyou...'
Someone might get upset or jealous. I hadn't been\npaying enough attention to my own actions\nrecently.
'Um, uh, I appreciate that. I like that you were\nworried about me. It, um, makes me happy!'
'And I really don't mind at all... It's okay! I'm\nfine with just the two of us!'
'I'm glad to hear that.'
I don't really like to worry too much about what\nother people think about me, so I was glad Asa\nfelt that way too.
'Uh, um...'

'I've always wanted to be like that myself. I
mean, to be able to be kind to people, just
naturally, and to notice what they're feeling and
stuff.'
'Huh? I think you're kinder than I am, Asa.'
'Mmnnn... But I'm just me. It's better coming\nfrom you!'
'I, Is that supposed to be a compliment?'
'Yes!'
I didn't really understand her, but apparently\nshe was complimenting me, which was nice.
It certainly didn't feel bad to be complimented\nby a cute girl like Asa, so I decided not to push\nthe subject.
'My grandfather was kind and open minded like you\ntoo.'
'He was an amazing person, so good at reading\nother people and looking out for their feelings.'
'Sorry, it's just that talking with you made me\nthink of my grandfather a little...'
'I see.'
I was surprised to hear her suddenly talking\nabout the chairman of the board. Now I\nunderstood.
It was interesting to think that I was similar to\nthe school's chairman...
I was glad to be complimented, but it felt a bit\nstrange to be compared to someone so old...
'That's why he was able to make these.'
As she spoke, Asa looked at the windmills lining\nthe hill.
At some point this group of windmills had become\nthe symbol of this town.
Just the other day I'd learned that they were\nbuilt by Asa's grandfather.
'I love these windmills.'
'I like them too. The scenery's much nicer now\nthat they're here. They give the place some\natmosphere.'
'Now that you mention it, you moved away from\nthis town once, and moved back last year, right?'
'Yeah, that's right. So I was surprised to see\nthese when I came back.'
And I immediately thought they were Kazegaura's\nnew distinctive feature.
'I was really surprised too, when these were\nfirst made, at what a gorgeous spectacle they\nwere.'
'And I thought, wow, my grandfather really is\namazing...'
'It's nice to have someone so amazing in your\nfamily.'
'Hee hee. I really am proud to have exceptional\npeople like Yoru and my grandfather in my\nfamily.'
'You really are a good girl, Asa.'
'Huh, what do you mean?!'
'I think it's pretty difficult to compliment my\nown relatives so freely.'
'Ah, I see. It's true that most people don't do\nit much.'
Most people our age were too embarrassed or\nrebellious to say such nice things about their\nfamilies.
'So I just thought, wow, that's really good of\nyou.'
'...I'm really not that good, though. Really.'
'Huh?'
For some reason Asa's expression had grown dark.
At first I thought she was just being humble, but\nit looked like that wasn't the case.
'Windmills don't work without wind, right?'
'...Ummm, well, they are windmills, after all.'
Windmills were built to produce energy when their\nblades were pushed and turned by the wind.
So of course they were useless without wind.
They were a lot like the glider our club was\nbuilding, which couldn't fly without wind.
'Yoru once mentioned that wind power's a pretty\ntroublesome thing. It's so easily affected by the\nenvironment, and it's costly to maintain.'
'Since the windmills just blow around in the\nwind, they look so simple and easy, but they're\nactually kind of incomplete.'

'Depending on how you look at it, it's actually
harder to find an environment for yourself where
you can be useful. Or that's what I've been
told.'
'Hmmm.'
She must have heard that from her grandfather.
'But because of that, seeing these windmills in a\nplace where they can be of use, seeing them\nsuccessful in their placement...'
'They look so wonderful that I'm actually jealous\nof them.'
'So I love these windmills. They seem to try so\nhard at what they do.'
'...You have an interesting way of thinking,\nAsa.'
'Really?'
It was hard to put my finger on just what it was,\nbut she was definitely kind.
And emotional about everything.
'I think it's the other way around. It's because\nI'm not interesting at all that I think that\nway.'
And poetic?
Asa's expression looked so dark and lonely that I\ncouldn't restrain myself.
Pat, pat, stroke.
'Whaa? Wh, what are you doing?! Why are you\nstroking my head?'
'No, it's just, you're so cute.'
'Wha... Whaaaaaa?!'
For some reason I'd just wanted to pat her on the\nhead.
'Wh, why? Why do you say that?'
'No reason, I just thought this might make you\nfeel better.'
'It, It won't!!'
I kept patting her head as we approached the\ndock.
'Wow! This dock really is great!'
When we reached the dock, we were greeted by\nKotori, who was cooing in admiration at\nsomething.
'Ageha! Where's Ageha?'
'Here I am. What is it, Kotori?'
'Once upon a time, you were a member of the Robot\nClub, were you not?'
'You know that without asking... And what's up\nwith the way you're talking?'
'Let's make one! A robot! Seriously!'
Kotori wasn't making any sense.
Maybe the heat was getting to her brain.
'With equipment like this, it'd be a piece of\ncake to make a robot. We could make a windmill,\nshaped one called Neo Holland.'
'Neo... Holland?'
'I'm not sure what you're talking about, but...\nAt any rate, I'm not making it, so good luck with\nthat, Kotori.'
'Aah, you're no fun, Ageha.'
'...I see you're all still idiots.'
Yoru was the next to arrive after us.
'Oh, Yoru, that was quick. Didn't you have\ncleaning duty?'
'I hurried here after I finished. I saw you\nwalking along with my sister.'
'Is there something wrong with us walking\ntogether?'
'Yes, there is! You're probably contagious.'
What, did she think I was some sort of virus?
'Yoru was worried that Asa might be taken\nadvantage of.'
'Huh? You too, Kanako?'
'What's up? Why are you here, Kana?'
'I just happened to run into Yoru when I left the\nschool. I wanted to see Soaring's new location,\nso I came along with her.'
I see.
But to think I'd take advantage of Asa... Just\nhow untrustworthy did Yoru think I was?
'This really is a nice place. It feels like a\nsecret base!'
'Right? Doesn't it? It's so exciting! It makes me\nfeel more motivated!'
'You guys really are idiotic.'
Yoru spat the words out sharply.
'Hmm, maybe I'll join Soaring too...'
'You were already turned down once, weren't you?'
'That was when everyone was still just getting to\nknow each other, right? Now that we've moved on\npast that, it should be fine!'
That might actually be true.
'But I couldn't come every day, so... Hmm, what\nto do...'
'Why don't you just keep showing up whenever you\nfeel like it, like you do now? It doesn't really\nmatter if you're an official member or not.'
'Oh, right!'
It wouldn't make much difference to her behavior\nwhether she was officially accepted or not.
Besides, Kanako was so fickle that there's no way\nshe'd actually show up every day.
'You must be happy, Aoi, surrounded by so many\ngirls in a facility far from the school.'
'I'll start rehearsing for when the police come\nto question me!'
'...Rehearsing what?'
'I'll tell them I always saw a crime in the\nmaking.'
'Stop saying stuff like that.'
I wasn't that type of person.
'Don't you all have studying to do for the tests\ncoming up? You certainly seem confident, just\nblabbing the time away.'
'There's nothing to get worked up about. I study\nregularly anyway.'
'Really? Are you actually a great student,\nKotori?'
'Heh heh, I may not look it, but my grades are\nsome of the best in the school!'
Yoru looked genuinely surprised.
'How rude. Despite appearances, I really do have\ngood grades.'
'Whaaaa?!'
Even Asa was surprised.
But I suppose that was understandable.
When I first saw her, she'd seemed a real\n'beauty,' but now she just looked like an idiot.
'Um, then, if I have something I don't\nunderstand, can I come ask you for help, Kotori?'
'Yeah, leave it to me! After all, I'm older than\nyou.'
Kotori puffed out her chest cockily.
She's probably just thrilled to have someone\nyounger looking up to her.
'In that case, I think I'll ask you next time I'm\nstuck...'
'Huh? Sis, I'll help you!'
'It's not fair of me to depend on you all the\ntime, and since we live in the same dorm and\neverything...'
'A, and, I've always wanted to get some help on\nmy studies from an older student...'
'Hmph. I'm perfectly capable of teaching you\nwhatever you need, but whatever.'
Yoru started pouting.
I guess Yoru usually tutored Asa. Yoru was\ndefinitely smart.
'Well then, let's all get together soon to\nstudy!'
'Huh?'

'Well, we're all living under one roof now, and
tests are coming up soon. Clubs are important
too, but as students, we should be concerned
about the tests!'
'Studying is what being a student is about after\nall!'
Kanako spoke up.
'That might be a good idea. The club's been\ntaking up so much time that I've been neglecting\nmy studies a bit.'
'B, but, if I we don't make pretty quick\nprogress, we'll miss Morning Glory...'

'We'll be fine if we keep up this pace. This
equipment has really cut down on construction
time. And we won't be working here at night
anyway, right?'

There was a lot more equipment here than in the
school's garage, and An-chan had been so prompt
getting supplies that our work was going faster
than expected.
It should be no problem to go home a bit early to\nstudy.
'Y, you're right. And if anyone fails a test\nbecause of the club, Tobioka's gonna make us stop\nthe club completely.'
'Exactly.'
'Ah, maybe I'll join you then!'
'It'd be lonely to be the only one not included.\nIs it okay if I come?'
'You're always welcome, Ageha!'
It looked like Ageha would be joining us.
'W, well then, today we're all going to study.'
'If there's anything you don't understand, feel\nfree to ask me! You too, Yoru.'
'The stuff they teach at school isn't even a\nchallenge to me.'
'Well, then, Kotori...'
'What?'
'Teach me!'
'...I can't teach someone in a grade higher than\nme.'
'...What about you, Yoru?'
'No.'
'Come on!!'
'Stop asking people younger than you to teach\nyou...'
'Aaaah...'
That night...
We decided to hold the study session in the\ndining room of Flying Fish Manor.
'Alright, for this kind of problem, just do this,\nand... There.'
'Wow, you're so smart, Amane!'
And for some reason Amane even joined us.
'That's great that there's someone to help you\nhere, Kanako.'
'It really was a coincidence.'
Just as we'd finished up at our club and started\nto leave, we ran into Amane, who'd come to check\nup on us.
She'd been in the neighborhood for her work, and\neven though she knew it was a bit late,\napparently she'd wanted to stop by for a bit.
Amane came to visit Soaring when she could get\ntime between shifts, but she couldn't come every\nday.
But since she'd agreed to come, she felt\nresponsible, and came as much as she felt she\ncould.
'What's that paper, Ageha?'
'Heh heh, actually I managed to get my hands on a\ncopy of last year's test. It's from a different\nteacher, but I thought it might be useful.'
'Oooh, not fair! Lemme see it!'
'Trade me one meal for it!'
'Ah, that's harsh, Ageha!'
'Hee hee, if you want me to show it to you,\nyou've gotta give me something in return!'
'Urgh...'
'(sigh)... Can't you be just a little quieter\nwhen we're studying?'
'Wow, Amane's really here!'
'Uh, umm, we came because we heard that Amane\nwould help us study...'
'Can we join you...?'
For some reason, even the other dorm residents\ncame down to study.
Amane's really popular...
'You really are kind, Amane. You really didn't\nhave to come all the way here just to help us\nstudy.'
'...I don't think that's it.'
'Huh?'
I won't deny that she's kind, but I don't think\nthat's the reason she came to the dorm.
In her case...
'By the way, Aoi...'
'Yes?'
'Umm... Where's the curry?'
'Ah, wait just a little longer. It's cooking\nright now.'
'(stomach rumble)'
'I see... Ahaha!'
It wasn't as though Amane had demanded the curry\nor anything.
When we'd been talking about dinner, we heard her\nstomach rumble, and after asking if she'd been\neating enough lately, we brought her along.
'...Why are human bodies so inconvenient? We have\nto eat to keep them running.'
'So I should just... yeah... make a body that...'
If she were able to create a body that didn't\nneed food, she'd definitely appear in textbooks.
At any rate, it was going to be a little while\nbefore dinner was ready, so everyone started\nstudying right away.
'It's been a while since I've had curry. It\nreminds me of the first time I met Aoi.'
'Yeah, back when I couldn't tell you and Yoru\napart. I remember Asa bought some really\nexpensive meat for the curry...'
'Whoa, don't say it! Don't remind me!'
'But it was seafood.'
'Uuuuunnnngh!!'
'Hahaha! Have you gotten better at shopping?'
'I, I'm still not too confident...'
Apparently she still hadn't learned the basics of\nshopping.
'N, next time, teach me how to do it!'
'I don't think it's something that's really\ntaught... But sure, I'll help.'
She should be able to pick things like that up\nlittle by little just by living here, like with\nthe cooking recently.
After eating our curry, we returned to our\nstudies.
Maybe we were all sleepy after the meal, because\nI noticed less chatting and more yawning, but we\nall managed to stay awake and study hard.
The only one who kept studying silently without a\nsingle yawn was Yoru.
'You really are amazing, Yoru.'
'...What do you mean?'
She sounded annoyed and looked at me\nsuspiciously. I guess she didn't appreciate me\ninterrupting her studying.
'I just meant, your book...'
The reference book Yoru was using wasn't a first\nyear book.

It was more like a review book for people who
were hoping to pass higher level entrance exams
or to get a job, with a review section of their
first year studies.
Usually, a first year student wouldn't understand\nit.
'I've already studied all of this myself. I just\nlisten in class for review.'
Yoru seemed to be even smarter than I'd thought.
Along with Kotori and Amane, I was surrounded by\na lot of excellent students.
It made me feel a bit sad about myself.
'Yoru's always been able to memorize the contents\nof any book she reads. Her memory is really\nastonishing.'
'...It, it's nothing to brag about.'
'It certainly is! Didn't you do really well on\nthe midterms, too?'
'She was number one in all subjects.'
That's seriously fantastic!
I couldn't help but be amazed.
'You really are incredible, Yoru.'
'I said it was nothing special!'
'I'm proud of my little sister.'
'Then you should have been able to teach me...'
Sigh... I wondered if Yoru was actually a genius\nthough.
Memorizing entire books after reading them once,\nand getting top marks in every subject...
She must have been born different from the rest\nof us. She reminded me of...
'I was just wondering, which of you is smarter,\nAmane or Little Kazato?'
'Huh?'
Amane looked startled and the sudden question,\nand glanced at me.
That's right. Yoru reminded me of Amane.
'...What do you mean, Little Kazato?'
'You're the younger of the Kazato sisters, right?\nAren't you Asa's little twin sister?'
'Why do you call Sis by her name but I just get\n'Little Kazato'?'
'You called me noisy and irritating earlier! I\nheard you!'
'What a childish reason. I said you were noisy\nand irritating because you were, in fact, being\nnoisy and irritating. What's wrong with that?'
'Huh? You need to learn to respect your elders!'

'Regardless of age, I only respect who I choose
to. Respecting people simply because they were
born earlier than you is a terribly outdated
custom.'
'Who are you calling outdated?! I'm not that much\nolder than you!'
'This is more of a question of mental age. And\nafter all, if you're not much older than I am, I\ndon't owe you that much respect, do I?'
'Argh... You've got an answer to everything,\nhaven't you?'
Why was Kotori even bothering to argue?
But I did wonder the same thing as Kotori.
Which one of them was more of a genius?
'Amane or Yoru, huh? They may both be geniuses,\nbut they sure are different types of girls! Heh\nheh!'
'I think even Amane couldn't beat Yoru.'
Apparently Ageha and Asa were wondering too.
'Hey, I've got a good idea! Why don't the two of\nyou have a genius contest?'
At that point Kanako stood up and announced her\nstrange idea.
'...Genius?'
'Contest...?'
'Yeah, a genius contest! Yoru and Amane can\ncompete to see which is the bigger genius!'
'...And how would they compete?'
'Hmmm... Oh yeah, I've got an old book in my room\nfull of quiz questions from an educational TV\nshow. Let's use that!'
'It's a 'modern education quiz book,' full of\nreally tough questions that most people can't\nanswer!'
'But what is the point of this contest?'

'Well, everyone's wondering, so let's figure it
out! Isn't that a good enough reason? But
actually maybe that's not exciting enough. We
should up the stakes a little!'
'In that case, the loser doesn't get to eat any\npudding for dessert tonight!'
'Oh, come on... I paid for my share...'
'And the winner gets two puddings!'
'What makes you think you can decide all these\nthings? I don't feel like participating in this\ncontest...'
'Oh, are you running away?'
'I'm not running. I'm just saying I don't have\nany obligation to do this.'
'Well, I suppose you're right. Little Kazato\ncould never beat Amane anyway.'
'Are you trying to provoke me? Sorry, but I'm not\nthat easily fooled.'
'Really? You sure were ready to fight earlier.'
'...You were the only one trying to pick a fight,\nTori.'
'Tori?!'
'You think like a bird. I thought I'd cut your\nname down to a size you could handle.'
'Aaaaaaaargh!!!'
What's the point of her getting provoked?
'Yoru, this is no good. You should try to get\nalong.'
'You can say that all you want, Sis, but she's\nthe one who started it.'
'That's why you've got to be an adult about it.'
Now even Asa was treating Kotori like a child.
'And anyway, I really wanna see you win this\ncontest.'
'...Eeehh?'
'I want to see it.'
'Do you really mean that, Sis?'
'I'm sure my Yoru wouldn't lose. I want Kotori to\nsee that.'
She probably was serious.
Asa really loved Yoru, and wouldn't like seeing\nher made fun of.
'What a pain... This is so pointless.'
'I want to see you doing what you do best.'
'Aaaah, okay, okay! Why are we even doing this\nright before the tests?! I'll do just a little,\nokay?'
Yoru really couldn't resist Asa, it seemed.
'This is getting exciting!'
'I'm betting on Amane, 'cause she's older.'
'Both of you, do your best!'
'Hey, Aoi, this is getting fun, huh?'
'Yeah, although it's pretty pointless.'
'Hee hee! Bow down before the power of Amane,\nLittle Kazato!'
'This isn't even about you, Kotori.'
Despite the tests coming up, everyone was really\nworked up about this contest instead.
'Alright, I've got the quiz book.'

'I'll give you about 30 questions, and the one
with the highest score is the winner. It'll be
mostly based on speed, but if you answer at the
same time you both get points. Alright, are you
two ready?'
'(nods, looking completely unmotivated)'
'(nods, looking like she really doesn't care)'
The audience was way more interested in this\ncontest than the actual contestants.
'Okay, first question. Say there are 40 students\nin a classroom. What is the probability that any\ntwo of them share the same birthday?'
'Umm... 90 percent.' 'Er, it's 90 percent.'
'You're both right. Wow!'
'Oooh!'
The audience reacted excitedly.
'How do you even figure that out...?'
'I, I have no idea...'
'Hmm, well, first you figure out the probability\nthat none of them share a birthday, and then you\nsubtract that from 100 percent!'
Of course Kotori knew how to get the answer.
But even knowing how, a normal person wouldn't be\nable to do the calculation so quickly.
'Okay, moving on to the next question. If you put\nall the blood vessels in the body end to end, how\nlong would they be?'
'Half the circumference of the Earth.' 'Half the\ncircumference of the Earth, of course.'
'W, wow...'
If these two were ever on a quiz show, they could\ndo pretty well for themselves.
Yoru was still a student, too... Was 'Ultra Quiz'\nstill on the air?
'If you add the 'kanreki' and 'kiju' ages\ntogether, how many do you get?'
'Their minds sure work quickly...'
'I wouldn't be able to come up with that\nimmediately.'
'What number is the current Mt. Fuji?'
'Huh...' 'The third.'
'Oh? Yoru gets a point.'
'Heh heh. I take it social studies aren't your\nstrong point?'
'...That was a ridiculous question, but I still\ndon't like losing.'
'Amane seems like she wouldn't be great at social\nstudies.'
'Yeah, but...'
'How many people are shown in Michelangelo's 'The\nLast Judgement'?'
'Amane gets a point!'
'...Alright.'
Both of them knew a lot of trivia.
'Next question! What famous French king is known\nfor saying 'I am the state'?'
'Louis XIV.' 'Louis XIV.'
'Next...'
'Thanks again for today! It was fun. Thanks for\nhaving me over.'
'Yeah, be careful on your way home.'
'...It's nice to do things like this once in a\nwhile. It's fun to go a little crazy with\neverybody sometimes.'
'And your cooking is really good, Aoi!'
'Thanks very much. It's fun for me to cook for\nyou too, since you appreciate it so much.'
'...Heh, then I'll have to come hungry again.'
'Just please make sure you eat every day.'
'Okay, Aoi. Bye bye!'
I saw the two of them off and then returned to\nthe living room.
'It feels like a storm has passed, doesn't it?'
'Yeah.'
'(sigh) What a clamorous evening.'
'But it was fun! And we managed to study a lot\ntoo.'

'Really? I think gathering together to study is a
waste of time. I can use my time more efficiently
when I study by myself, and concentrate better
too.'
'And we totally wasted time with that contest.\nEven if you need help, Asa, I can do that\nmyself...'
Yoru kept grumbling.
'But you seemed to be having fun too, Yoru.'
'N, not at all.'
'When you were competing against Amane, you sure\nlooked like you were having fun to me!'
'D, definitely not...!'
'You know you enjoyed it!'
'Aaaaah, cut it out, Sis! Of course I didn't\nenjoy it! I lost!'
'But Yoru, didn't you say you didn't care who won\nor lost such a silly contest?'
'Urgh!'
In the end, Amane was the winner of the genius\ncontest.
The age gap may have made a difference, too. Yoru\nwas amazing, but Amane was even more so.
Everyone else had already left.
Kotori had raised a glass of cola in honor of\nAmane's victory and then headed back to her room,\nand Kanako had gone off to take a bath.
'I don't like you anymore, Sis! I'm going to\nstart hating you from now on!'
'No, don't hate me, Yoru! I just shared half of\nmy pudding with you!'
'That was an entirely different matter. I've\nalready decided. I hate you.'
'Aaah, don't hate me, Yoru, come on!'
'Then give me another pudding. Just one isn't\nenough.'
'...Is tomorrow okay?'
'Any time is okay to give me sweets.'
'Alright, let's go with that! You're sure\ntomorrow's okay?'
Yoru nodded. It looked like things had settled\ndown.
'Thank goodness! I'll go do the dishes now.'
'Go for it, Sis.'
We'd left the dishes until after the study party,\nand now Asa went to clean them up.
It was her turn to clean up today, but she'd\nwaited until everyone went home.
'Sis is pretty funny.'
'Huh?'
'And she's kind. I think she got me to join in\nthat contest because she wants me to mix with the\ngroup more. What do you think?'
'Aaah, yeah, Asa may have been thinking that.'
She was good at reading the atmosphere and\nlooking out for people's feelings.
'But she certainly didn't need my opinion about\njoining Soaring or moving in to this dorm.'
'Sometimes she's pretty straightforward.'
'She really wanted to leave the house... And I\nthink she loves the sky.'
'Sis has always admired the sky.'
She admires the sky?
Asa had thought about the windmills in a rather\ndifferent way.
I wondered exactly how Asa felt about the sky.
'...(sigh) And why did I get so serious about\nthat contest, anyway?'
'Wasn't it fun?'
'It wasn't fun. I'm upset that I lost.'
Yoru heaved another big sigh.
'It just feels like such a huge waste of time to\nplay with people, and talk with them when I don't\nhave a reason to, and just have a conversation.'
'Life is a limited resource, and I don't want to\nwaste it.'
Yoru didn't like interacting with other people,\nand tried to avoid it.
She really was the exact opposite of Asa, who\nseemed to enjoy everything so much.
But why was it...
...that Yoru's contrary attitude didn't grate on\nmy nerves?
More often than not, she just looked lonely to\nme.
'But I suppose it's not a bad thing to indulge in\nthese things every now and then.'
And she chuckled.
With just a hint of self, deprecation in her\nexpression, Yoru smiled.
For some reason that smile looked lofty, and\nbeautiful.
'You're a lot cuter when you smile, Yoru.'
'Huh?'
She was cute.
'I don't see you smile much, but you're so much\ncuter when you do.'
'Wh, what are you saying? Stop teasing me!'
'I, I wasn't teasing...'
'Never mind! I'm going to my room.'
Yoru's smile vanished and was replaced with an\neven fiercer scowl than usual, and she angrily\nleft the room.
Aww, even though she's so cute when she smiles...
'Hey, Aoi!'
My thoughts were interrupted by Kanako.
'I, I've told you, put some clothes on!'
'Sorry, sorry. I just got out of the bath, so it\ncan't be helped.'
'Yes it can!!'
I'd finally gotten used to the sight, so I didn't\nhave to turn my face away anymore, but...
'I think you should learn to be a little happier\nthat you get to see a young girl in her\nunderwear, Aoi.'
'Underwear is exciting to guys because we don't\nusually get to see it. When I see it every single\nday...'
'Aaah, you're already sick of me?'
'Stop saying things that could be misunderstood.'
'Anyway, here's my thanks for the study party\ntoday. Go ahead, look all you like! Whee!'
'I said stop it! I'm a guy, you know! What if I\ntried to take advantage of you?!'
'If it were you, Aoi...'
Kanako was really kind of a pain...
'Thanks for today, though.'
'Hm? For what?'
'It was fun. And I got help with my studies from\nAmane.'
'Yoru even joined in the fun, which is unusual.'
She gave me a very satisfied smile as she spoke.
'You're really kind to those two.'
'Well, they're my cute little juniors.'
'In that case, aren't I your cute little junior\ntoo?'

'Hm? I thought I was spoiling you every bit as
much as them, but I guess it wasn't getting
across to you. Look, I'm even showing you my
underwear!'
'But I've told you, that's a problem...'
'And to tell you the truth, I think of those two\ngirls as a second chance.'
'A second chance?'
'I didn't get along well with Kotori at first,\nremember? Back when you first came here.'
'Ah, yes. I remember.'
'So I thought I'd do better this time.'
I see. So this was her second chance.
'Those two girls are like rich little princesses,\nbut they seem to hate being treated differently\nfrom others because of that.'

'It must be hard on them, whether or not I really
understand it... So anyway, I try to treat them
normally, and just be like an older sister to
them. What do you think?'
'I think that's really great of you.'
I really did.
'After all, they left such a rich home to come\nlive in a dorm like this.'
'They must have something bothering them that\nwould make them do that. So I wanted to be of\nhelp if I could.'
I see. So that's why.
...She did seem to have a point.
Even though they were the daughters of a\nprestigious household, they chose to move to this\ndorm.
They might really have some serious worries that\nmade them want to leave home.
It might just be youthful rebellion... But...
'I see. At any rate, if I ever see them in\ntrouble, I definitely want to help them.'
'Oh... Have you fallen for the two of them, by\nany chance?'
'N, no, that's not it.'
'This is suspicious... Aoi, do you like much\nyounger girls? Or maybe, do you even have a\nLolita complex?'
'What makes you think that?!'
'I just thought that would explain why you don't\nget excited looking at me!'
'Th, that's not it. I just don't get excited\nlooking at you, that's all.'
'What a hurtful thing to say!!'
I had to think about that for a while.
